silhouette.constraints
Class attachPt1ToNearestCompassPt

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--silhouette.constraints.constraint
        |
        +--silhouette.constraints.attachPtToNearestCompassPt
              |
              +--silhouette.constraints.attachPt1ToNearestCompassPt
public class attachPt1ToNearestCompassPt
extends silhouette.constraints.attachPtToNearestCompassPt

Attaches the first endpoint to one of the eight compass points on the attaching object. The reference object is used to determine which compass point would look most pleasing. If the attach object is smaller than the reference object, then the constraint tries to attach the endpoint to the corner of the attaching object unless the leading edge of the attaching object is near the center of the reference object. If the attach object is bigger than or equal in size to the reference object, then the endpoint is attached to the corner of the attaching object if the attaching object does not overlap the reference object; otherwise the endpoint is attached to the center of the attaching object (the endpoint is also attached to the center of the attaching object if the two objects are about to overlap--moving the attach point just before the objects overlap prevents the line between the two objects from ever being vertical or horizontal, which looks ugly). If the attaching object actually intersects the reference object, then the line may be attached to the actual center of the attaching object, rather than one of the eight compass points.
